headline: Light Up Halloween with Adorable Airblown® Animal Characters
summary: Looking for Halloween décor that's more sweet than spooky? Explore the charming lineup of animal Airblown® Halloween Lights at Walmart this season. Designed with animal lovers in mind, each piece will add joy, fun, and family-friendly curb appeal to any seasonal display!

headline: Walmart (WMT) Expands With High-Tech Centers And Launches Collector's Night Series
summary: Walmart (WMT) has experienced a price movement of 5% over the past week, aligning closely with its business momentum marked by the grand opening of a new perishable distribution center and the launch of "Collector's Night." The opening of the high-tech center is a distinguished example of Walmart's efforts to enhance supply chain efficiency and create jobs, while "Collector's Night" aims to capture consumer interest in the collectibles market. These initiatives occur against the backdrop of a...

headline: PEBBLES™ Cereal Hits the Road on the All New Pebbles Pay Tour
summary: Ditch your wallet, forget credit cards, and leave cash behind when you attend the Pebbles Pay Tour at select Walmart locations. The Pebbles Pay Tour will make four stops, and fans who stop by can exchange a handful of pebbles, rocks, or stones and receive a FREE box of Fruity PEBBLES™ or Cocoa PEBBLES™ cereal while supplies last.

headline: Dave Ramsey Slams Parents For Coddling 19-Year-Old Walmart Worker Living Rent-Free, Warns You're Robbing Him Of His Future
summary: Personal finance expert Dave Ramsey delivered tough love to parents on The Ramsey Show on Wednesday after a caller asked how to help her 19-year-old son, who dropped out of college, works part-time at Walmart, and still lives at home without paying bills. Ramsey Questions Why Work Ethic Was Never Taught The caller explained her son earns $14 an hour and also collects about $10,000 a year in dividends but often burns through his money and borrows for gas.
